Package net.minestom.server.utils.binary

Class BinaryWriter

java.lang.Object
java.io.OutputStream
net.minestom.server.utils.binary.BinaryWriter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
public class BinaryWriter
extends java.io.OutputStream
Class used to write to a byte array. WARNING: not thread-safe.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    BinaryWriter()
    Creates a BinaryWriter with a "reasonably small initial capacity".
    BinaryWriter​(int initialCapacity)
    Creates a BinaryWriter using a heap buffer with a custom initial capacity.
    BinaryWriter​(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf... buffers)
    Creates a BinaryWriter from multiple buffers.

    • writeSizedString

      public void writeSizedString​(java.lang.String string)
      Writes a string to the buffer.

      The size is a var-int type.

      Parameters:
      string - the string to write

    • writeShortSizedString

      public void writeShortSizedString​(java.lang.String string)
      Writes a string to the buffer.

      The size is a short type.

      Parameters:
      string - the string to write

    • writeVarIntArray

      public void writeVarIntArray​(int[] array)
      Writes a var-int array to the buffer.

      It is sized by another var-int at the beginning.

      Parameters:
      array - the integers to write

    • writeBytes

      public void writeBytes​(byte[] bytes)
      Writes a byte array.

      WARNING: it doesn't write the length of bytes.

      Parameters:
      bytes - the byte array to write

    • writeStringArray

      public void writeStringArray​(java.lang.String[] array)
      Writes a string to the buffer.

      The array is sized by a var-int and all strings are wrote using writeSizedString(String).

      Parameters:
      array - the string array to write

    • write

      public void write​(java.util.function.Consumer<BinaryWriter> consumer)
      Consumer this object to write at a different time
      Parameters:
      consumer - the writer consumer

    • writeUuid

      public void writeUuid​(java.util.UUID uuid)
      Writes an UUID. It is done by writing both long, the most and least significant bits.
      Parameters:
      uuid - the UUID to write
